status_message: As Chair of the Franchise Tax Board, I want Californians to know about a program called ReadyReturn.   ReadyReturn provides many of the state's taxpayers with a filled-in or completed tax return that is ready for their review and ready to e-file - all for free.  To check, go to ftb.ca.gov and click on ReadyReturn.
Thank you to Legal Momentum, The Women's Legal Defense and Education Fund for honoring me as the inaugural recepient of the Men of Distinction Award.

I am starting the day with a 5:15 am radio interview on KGO (Bay Area) to discuss California's cash position and revenues and disbursements in February.  A copy of my monthly report can be found at www.sco.ca.gov.

My office is partnering once again with KABC in Southern California to help reunite property owners with their lost property.  Viewers can call in to the number posted during the evening news.  One can also go to www.claimit.ca.gov.
Later today, I will deliver the keynote address at the National Association of Women Business Owners Policy Summit where I will discuss what is required to keep California globally competititive.

This morning I am visiting Toyota Headquarters to get an update on advances in fuel cell technology and to speak to the employees about clean technology and the economy.  In America, we spend - on average - more than $1000 for every child, woman and man on imported oil.
I look forward to attending the Young Storytellers Foundation's fundraiser tonight.  The charity supports arts education in underserved, arts-poor public schools in the greater Los Angeles area.

Congratulations to the Honorable Ted Lieu, my state senator, on the occasion of his district swearing-in ceremony.  Ted deserves recognition for his work to highlight and end unscrupulous financial practices.
